text: This is a game-changer! Finally, my emotional contributions to projects will be recognized! 😄
I think it's a great way to promote mental health awareness in the developer community. We all need a bit of emotional support sometimes.
Agreed! This could potentially foster a more supportive and collaborative environment. Let's hope it encourages more empathy among developers.
I can't wait for the first emotional support commit conflicts. "My emotional support is better than yours!" 😂
Haha, imagine having to merge emotional support commits from different branches. It'll be a rollercoaster of emotions!
Definitely adds a new meaning to "emotional baggage" in the codebase. Will we need therapy sessions for resolving merge conflicts now?
I wonder if they'll introduce a new metric to measure the impact of emotional support commits on the project's progress. Emotional velocity, anyone?
As long as it doesn't become another way to micromanage developers... "You haven't met your emotional support quota for this sprint!" 😆
Don't give managers any ideas! We'll be drowning in emotional support JIRA tickets soon enough.
Don't give the JavaScript community any ideas, they might just do it! 😅
Too late, I'm already working on a prototype. Emojicode, here we come!
